In the following if the smallest circle represents candidates clearing GSET exam, bigger circle represents candidates clearing only Paper-I of the GSET exam and the biggest circle represents the candidates who failed in the GSET exam, then choose the diagram which correctly represents this relationships.

Consider the following statement followed by two assumptions (i) and (ii). Choose the correct answer. Statement : "You are hereby appointed as a programmer with a probation period of one year and your performance will be reviewed at the end of the period for confirmation." A line in an appointment letter. Assumptions : (i) The performance of an individual is generally not known at the time of appointment offer. (ii) Generally an individual tries to prove his/her worth in the probation period.
options: (C) None of the assumptions (i) and (ii) are implicit.
(D) Both the Assumptions (i) and (ii) are implicit.

question_text: Of the following statements, there are two statements both of which cannot be false but both can be true. Which are these two statements? (i) All the students wish to complete their study. (ii) Some students do not like Mathematics. (iii) No student wishes to complete the study. (iv) No student likes Mathematics.

Evaluate the following statements in terms of whether each is a Fact, Opinion, Prejudice or Advice by choosing correct alternative. (i) Women are not suitable for police service. (ii) In democracy no party should be in power for too long (iii) Have proper rest even during examination time. (iv) Obesity is a risk factor for coronary heart diseases.

The question below is followed by two arguments numbered (i) and (ii). Decide which argument is strong. Question: Should India encourage exports when most things are insufficient for internal use itself? Arguments: (i) Yes. We have to earn foreign exchange to pay at least for our defence and other necessary exports. (ii) No. Even selective encouragement will lead to shortages.
options: (C) Both the Arguments (i) and (ii) are strong.
(D) None of the arguments (i) and (ii) are strong.

question_text: Consider the following two statements and choose the correct answer. Statement (i): There has been a high increase in the incidents of atrocities against women in the country during past few years. Statement (ii) : The police authority has been unable to nab the culprits committing crime against women.
options: (A) Statement (i) is cause and Statement (ii) is effect.
(B) Statement (ii) is cause and Statement (i) is effect.
(C) Statements (i) and (ii) are both independent of causes.
(D) Statements (i) and (ii) are both effects of some independent causes.
